page.title: 08Great Houghton Church
page.content: The{church}is the oldest,standing building in{Gt. Houghton.}It was built in 1650 as a Chapel of Ease by{Sir {Edward}Rodes,High Sheriff of Yorkshire.Mr.Edward Bowles, of York, one of the most eminent of the Presbyterian clergy, performed the first religious ceremony in the chapel when he baptised one of his younger sons. The patronage of the chapel depended entirely on the Rodes family and it had no endowment other than theirs and was always strongly Presbyterian. The area of Gt.Houghton is 1649 acres.In 1801 the population was 257, in 1901 it was 1220, in 1965 it was 2424 and now it has reached well over 3000.When we phoned Mr. Moulder, the curate, he told us that 24 people went to church on Sunday morning,and 40 in the evening.
